title: Account takeover through CSRF in http://███████/██████████/default.asp
content:
Summary:
Hi team,
I have found a CSRF vulnerability in http://██████/████/default.asp that leads to account takeover.
Step-by-step Reproduction Instructions
Go to http://██████████/████████/default.asp and login
Copy the below HTML code
Submit the request and see your profile
Try to login again with your username and password
Use the password ██████████. You will be logged in with ████ as a password.

Impact

steps: Copy the provided HTML code and submit the request to change the profile details, including the password
Attempt to login again with the original username and password, which will now fail
Use the new password '████' to login successfully, demonstrating account takeover
vuln_description: A CSRF vulnerability in the profile update functionality allows an attacker to change a user's password without their consent, leading to account takeover. The attack involves submitting a crafted form that modifies the user's profile, including setting a new password controlled by the attacker.
reason: The vulnerability is straightforward to exploit once the form structure is understood. It does not involve complex application states or novel logic, and the interaction between components is typical of CSRF attacks.
